website_summaries.verdict: RHA's MA750i earphones deliver a strong audio performance in a good-looking design, and you get plenty of eartips so you can find the perfect fit.
pros: Powerful audio performance with no distortion on deep bass tracks
Solid construction and design, with sturdy cable
Inline remote and microphone for mobile devices
cons: Could use a bit more high-mid presence

customer_reviews.title: Won't answer warranty claims
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these less then two years ago. Used maybe a dozen times and took really good care of them. The volume from the left earbud began sounding half the volume of the right. I contacted the company through the website and filled out the warranty form and have had no response back from them!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: High Quality + Excellent Warranty Support
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of earbuds. One of the first things I noticed about these earbuds was the quality of construction. Every single piece of them feels solid and looks nice. For example the cable is made out of nice high quality thick rubber. On top of the excellent construction quality the sound is also amazing. At one point the right earbud stopped outputting sound correctly, luckily I had purchased the 3 year warranty. I contacted support and within a day a replacement pair of earbuds was on their way.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: Great Earphones
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones. I've had many pairs of earbuds over the years and these RHA's really impress. The metal housing gives me confidence that these are going to hold up well to the wear and tear of daily use. So far I've been using these daily for two months and they have held up very well. Fit and comfort is great. I like the dual flange transparent tips because I like to take them in and out a lot while I'm at work. The foam tips work well too. Sound quality is very good, especially considering these are widely marketed and sold in airports etc. These are much better than my old Bose q20i's which were much less sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Evans

customer_reviews.title: My favorites
customer_reviews.text: I owned these for about a year, and absolutely loved them. The sound, fit, design, and quality of materials was great. I left them at Starbucks. I ended up using my back-up headphones of another brand (still in this price range, but by another manufacturer) and just had to purchase another of these RHA headphones. I!ve had them again for almost a year and just love them. They get daily use on my train/bus commute to and from work, and every day at work. I love these!
customer_reviews.author: ZestfullyClean

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, solid build quality, but odd physical design.
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to talk about build quality: the wire sheathing is very grippy and rubbery. In practice, they will very slowly slide down your clothes (let's say inside the collar of your jacket), and grip when you move your head in a way that would pull them out. RHA doesn't make a version compatible with Android, and that's pretty annoying. The audio quality is excellent for $130 and you can get an amazing overview of that and how it compared to others here:
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T

customer_reviews.title: The 750i headphones are fantastic headphones. I had purchased them
customer_reviews.text: The 750i headphones are fantastic headphones. I had purchased them, originally, to replace my Monster Turbine Pro Copper headphones and they did a pretty good job. After about 24 hours of break in, they sounded very nice and open with fantastic bass response. They are tremendously comfortable, probably the most comfortable headphones I've owned. Unfortunately, I had to send them back because the iPhone control was making my phone go nuts! Had this not been the case, these were definitely keepers. As it is, I sent them back and upgraded to the T20 headphones from RHA.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Reeves

customer_reviews.title: My favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: Ive purchased all kinds of headphones in the past. Beats powerbeats 2, Bose, sennheiser momentum. These are by far my favorite. It has a nice crisp sound. The fit is very comfortable and stay in place very well. You hear very little outside noise. The microphone seems to work really well as well. I also like that the cord doesn't make any sound when moved around. The only complaint I have is a wish that there was a little more bass to them
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound - Not So Great Longevity
customer_reviews.text: If you shell out your hard-earned bucks for these IEMs, just know that you are going to get wonderful sound - that is for as long as the cables last. When you purchase these, you may want to also purchase a bottle of super glue because you'll need it to repair the cable. The cable material is very soft and after repeated fatigue, it will start cracking. I'm not talking tight winding either. I treated these with the utmost respect. Also, don't expect RHA to do anything after your warranty is up because they won't. I guess they think that a year or so of use is worth $130. I'm not so sure.
customer_reviews.author: 50 Something Guy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them for $210
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these yesterday and noticed that they are now sold out. The next price for a new pair of these is $210 is ridiculous. I wanted to post to let everyone know they are still available for $130 at other locations (like apple). I'll give an actual review once I receive them as well. These earphones are excellent. They don't fall off when you're running and you can control the volume with ease. I can now answer phone calls without using those stupid bluetooth ear pieces!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. V

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer care
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. The sound is very crisp and fit is very comfortable. Sound isolation is very good. Im not an audiophile but i listened on this pairing with fiio x1 and iphone both sound fantastic. I listned to classical mostly and sound stage is really nice. I bought this product in late july 2015. Some issue cropped into my left ear piece but they honored thier warranty and send a replacement. Its really a pleasure to be customer of this company.
customer_reviews.author: Himas

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but some of the competitor are better.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Superb built quality. Cable is flexible, thick and durable. Driver housing is solid. - Bass and mid tone are detailed, solid and not distorted. Cons: - Treble is a little bit muffled. Some details are lost due to the lowered treble. - Fitting can be a problem due to the thick cable. Make sure that this one will sit tightly inside your ear or else the sound won't be good.
customer_reviews.author: Ultracer

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, good sound.
customer_reviews.text: These are very impressive headphones. The sound is good, much better than the standard Apple headphones, though not as crisp as Etymotics. But everything else about them is great - solid metal earbuds and controls, strong cables, metal strain reliefs, wide assortment of ear tips, with a metal carrier for the tips, and the controls work perfectly with the iPhone 5. For walking around and listening to music or talking on the phone, these earbuds are great, while for "serious listening" I'd still go for the (more fragile and more expensive) Etymotics.
customer_reviews.author: Laird A. Popkin

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud stop working after 9 months. The metal ...
customer_reviews.text: Left earbud stop working after 9 months. The metal spring on the cable makes it difficult to place phone in your pocket without it poking you whenever you sit down. Slightly adjusting the cable will will cause you to lose audio or hear nothing but static. Customer support is great though, send me a replacement since it was under warranty. Edit - Left earbud dead again.
customer_reviews.author: Ice Tea w/ Ketchup & Mayonnaise

customer_reviews.title: Brainwave S5 in ear buds and now the RHA 750i- these are by far the best over all sound quality of this group
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional nor would i consider myself a audiophile, however I have the Bose SoundTru, Brainwave S5 in ear buds and now the RHA 750i- these are by far the best over all sound quality of this group. Exceptiional range of sound and when used with my Pono unit, the classical and jazz selections are concert hall quality sound. Lenghty high quality thick cord, over the ear buds, with a great selection of ear pieces to find the set that fits you. Would recommend again
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: These are also remarkably comfortable, which is surprising because I have sensitive ears ...
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal sound, and machined build quality but I question the cord longevity where it meets the volume controls... it seems very flimsy after only a couple months of use. These are also remarkably comfortable, which is surprising because I have sensitive ears that balk at many headphones. I would recommend the foam tips (which I've hated before), or some Comply foam tips - for the best sound, deepest bass, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fine build quality!
customer_reviews.text: Build quality: extremely strong, vulnerable part are well protected by aluminum, ear bud is reinforced its hard to lose, wire protected by thick layer of fine plastic. 7 pair different back up ear buds for choosing. Sound quality: as expected. It makes little sound when rub with cloth when im walking. Perfect for gym fitness activity. The size is a bit larger than normal earphone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: High quality, well-performing ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound quality, especially for ear buds. I like the over-ear loop design, which works most of the time, though they don't always stay snug when I'm moving around a lot. I use these on the plane - as you'd expect, not as noise cancelling as full headphones, but much better than the Apple-provided buds or my old Monster buds. Work great for taking calls, and the materials are top-notch. Love the cord and the heavy duty hardware. Comes with a handy carrying case that includes different size pads. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about these earlier!
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. These sound as good if not better than my $300 Bowers-Wilkins P5. Very thoughtfully designed, and beautifully built with quality parts. There is plenty of bass, but its not exaggerated. Nice highs and midrange. Instant love. I have owned many many pairs of plugs in this price category including Shures, Bose and Klipsh. Personally, I think this blows them all away. Plenty of ear tips. Should fit most everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Murray Eisner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these last year, and was blown away by the quality. You don't notice the difference between good headphones and bad ones when you put the good ones in, but when you switch back to bad ones. Whenever I forgot these at home, I always grumbled when I listened to my backup pair. A week ago, I made the grave mistake of plugging them into a foreign jack that managed to completely fry one ear (manual of device said it was for a mechanical device, so had a very high voltage, so not the headphones' fault). I was getting ready to purchase a second pair, but made an inquiry first and they replaced them!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Coe

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are clearly sturdy - and that's great since most of us have had cheap ones break or fail. They are also heavy. Very heavy. I don't recall if the weight is in the specifications, but these weigh 40 grams, compared to my 30 gram iPod. They are bulky too. These are not discretely hiding in your hair, the non-tangle wires are doing their own thing where they want to do it.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: These are easily the best headphones I've ever owned. I've been crazy about headphones since I was a kid. They need to be comfortable and sound great. Usually that would end up with them being very expensive or not very durable or something else but that's not a problem here. I feel the price is fair and the build quality is exceptional as well. Also, the microphone does work with my Android (Nexus 4). The volume control doesn't seem to though.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. The sound quality is the greatest I've heard on earbuds. But they have one errant design flaw. You can not just clean earwax off the mesh. If it touches the mesh, you have to remove it to have any sound. In doing so it exposes the speaker, making it susceptible to taking damage from elements, sweat, earwax, or anything that may touch the inside speaker. I have lost 2 pairs to this issue. I'm going to try the t20i hoping that they don't have the same design issue. Love this product, but they could be far better
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones Pros
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones Pros: great sound, they do not get overly bright regardless of the volume. Bass is accurate, which is a surprise considering most headphones are a little heavy on the bass these days. Cons: zero uses for the in line remote on android devices. I was expecting the volume to work at a minimum. Good build quality, nice thick cables. A lot of tip options included. I would recommend these buds.
customer_reviews.author: anthonyparks

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, well-made, challenging design
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound. These are very well made and not at all flimsy. Wish they included more foam tips (mostly soft rubber). The over the ear wires aren't a great design for women(or men) with long hair as they are difficult to place under hair behind ears. The clip that comes with is not big enough to thread the wires through. Because I can't use the clip, the headphone wires (that are very long) end up dangling and thus pulling the earbuds out of my ears, because of my hair. If the sound wasn't as good as it is, I'd return them.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality and Sound Imaging
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the materials are top-notch, especially the earbud metal housing and the spring-enabled connector to the jack. Superb depth and imaging with refined bass and mid tones for everything from hip-hop to prog rock to jazz. As noted by others, if you want mega-bass in your buds, look elsewhere. Apple-like packaging is impressive. Well done, RHA!
customer_reviews.author: LahontanCut

customer_reviews.title: Used in-ear head phones...no thanks!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how they sound when something that goes in your ear arrives used no sense in trying it out! If it's going to be used just say it or at least open box..at least it's not underwear
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Audio heaven
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best sounding headphones I own. I have a collection with the previous king being the klipsch x4i. These destroy the klipsch I. Every aspect. The build is incredible, the styling is amazing, the sound is breath taking, and the comfort is awesome thanks to the foam ear pieces. If you have the money don't waste your time buying other headphones, you won't regret buying these.
customer_reviews.author: tiny94

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these! I understand that each individual has their ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! I understand that each individual has their preferences, but I am just glad that my hunt for the perfect pair of in-ear phones have come to an end. The sound is impressive, as is the clarity. The controls take a little getting used to, but are great once you have the tactile memory in place. The mic sound is great. All in all, a great buy for me!
customer_reviews.author: Vivek Sen

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. Honestly, for the price, they perform as damn well as any of those super expensive headphones you see for twice as much. The key is to *try the different fit pieces* to find the ones that fit you best. Proper placement will determine how well they isolate noise, and in my case even the bass. There's plenty of different size fits here, so most people should be covered. The thing I appreciate the most is the stainless steel construction. If you've ever had generic headphone plugs get all ruined, you will appreciate the heavy-duty construction on these. Definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I looked and read and watched youtube reviews and these were the perfect fit for my active lifestyle. I have done just about every workout you can think of and they don't come out. The construction is 2nd to none and the remote is going strong after the first 2 weeks (all the reviews I have read make me think this will not be a problem in the near future). My wife's friends all want some now (wife's are on order).
customer_reviews.author: BryanB

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones, and great customer service. I received my first set of these headphones, and they worked great. After 8 months or so, they completely stopped working so I filed a report with RHA. As I had had them for less than a year, they sent me a brand new set of headphones, for no cost, whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: FrostPatch

customer_reviews.title: Don't pass this by
customer_reviews.text: I have been through many headsets. Theses headsets happen to be the best ones by far for the price. The warranty is excellent, the comfort is wonderful and they are very durable. I would not waste my money on any Bose or monster products in the same category. Had both head phones by Bose n monster and they pale in comparison. Noise cancelation is superb! This is a purchase you wouldn't wAnt to by pass.
customer_reviews.author: Romeo-Bells

customer_reviews.title: Blows Your Mind Good!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today and all I can say is WOW. I am very critical of headphones and am able to pick up on subtle things in music that lower end headphones just can't deliver. These fit amazingly and come with 10 different ear tip pieces for the perfect fit. The sound is easily the most clear I have ever heard from in ear headphones and I am picking new things up from songs I've listened to hundreds of times. They isolate noise extremely well and hopefully nobody needs my assistance at work today because I won't be able to hear them unless they walk into my office screaming my name. Couldn't be more pleased with these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P.

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it as long as it doesn't break
customer_reviews.text: Its got above average sound very sturdy looking and feeling, i take average care of them but the left one just stopped all of a sudden and its falling apart i think I've had it for a couple months. I don't know who contact about the warranty would really like to get them fixed. Overall a great product though.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Dautremont

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic construction & sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic construction & sound quality, but I had to return mine because they stopped working. Probably just a manufacturing defect which could happen with any product... doesn't seem like other people have the issue. I'm not sure I will try this brand again though, not the best expierence.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Among the best at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Vibrant sound that feels balanced across all music genres. Built to take a beating with stainless steel everywhere. Among the best at this price point. Welcome to audiophile IEMs. Cons: If you've come for bass, look elsewhere. Packaging & Accessories: 8.5/10 Build Quality: 9.5/10 Design & Look: 8.5/10 (Stainless Steel housings may be flashy for some) Microphonics: 9.5/10 Isolation: 8.5/10 Comfort: 8.5/10 Sound Quality: 9/10 Value: 9/10 Final Rating: 9/10
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones! I used to use grados and koss ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones! I used to use grados and koss headphones all the time but now I pretty much exclusively use these. Very balanced sound but the oomph is there if the music calls for it. Plus when one of the buds broke after 1.5 years of heavy daily use they replaced it for free no hassle. 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: These are very nice ear buds with a premium sound and quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice ear buds with a premium sound and quality hardware. The problem is I can only use these when I'm not moving due to the wiring cover being pulled away from the connector and exposing and offering no protection to the wiring. I fear pulling the wires off the connectors and ruining them. I must admit I am very surprised due to the quality, but for the cost I am a little disappointed and sad as they made my daily walks much more enjoyable. These guys do Customer service the way it should be done, if you have a problem, contact them and they'll take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Der Rezensent

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic sound and comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating my review, though the rating is still five stars. I bought these in December 2015, and they are still going strong! Cris-crossing the planet for work, including some pretty rough and tumble places, these are still rocking. I read the other reviews, but my experience with the RHA MA750i has been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Third time #Fail
customer_reviews.text: Third replacement. Failed again. I'll look for another brand. Horrible feedback at random times making it unusable. Sometimes it works, sometimes not. It's often enough that I cannot use this very expensive headset for calling other people. The earbuds (with all the many replacements) slip out often. It's great idea but not great execution.
customer_reviews.author: RevInnovator

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews for this product from all camps are the same. Outstanding sound, build, packaging and accessories. I am extremely pleased to own these. They are a pleasure to use. The only fault I found was with the clothing clip, which consists of a cord holder with a swivel snap that attaches to the clip. The connection was weak and kept coming apart. I eventually lost the clip. RHA was very quick and courteous in response to my email and a replacement is on the way. I hope it is more secure than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Herndon

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third set of audiophile headphones and by far the least expensive. Granted the other two were bought more than a year ago, but these are absolutely incredible. The packaging is super high quality Apple like, but better. The sound is so superior to the other high-tier audiophile headphones I have owned there is no comparison. At about $100 these should be an automatic purchase for anyone who cares about quality audio. It is said MP3 tunes with earbuds are generally low quality audio, but these RHA's turn that 180 degrees. This rivals what I get in my car for about 1/15th the price. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Leadbellyjams

customer_reviews.title: Best earbuds available at any price.
customer_reviews.text: I do not normally endorse or recommend a product of any type. However, these earbuds have such realistic sound, such great tones, and I enjoy them so much it is necessary that I share my thoughts. I have bought between 25 and 50 sets of various prices and brands, including Sony, Bose, Apple and others. These eclipse anything I have tried. Do yourself a favor. These can't be beat. I got that from some of the reviews. If anything happens to dissuade me, i'll return.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They had amazing sound, just really too heavy for my ears
customer_reviews.text: They had amazing sound, just really too heavy for my ears. Had to return them and had no problem doing so and getting a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Sigalit Sapir

customer_reviews.title: Pretty uncomfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Pretty uncomfortable to wear. Especially impossible to wear if you have glasses. No size of earbud fit comfortably in my ear. Either they wouldn't fit or they kept falling out. The sound quality wasn't that impressive either. Wish I had refunded these... Got the Bose Soundsport wireless afterwards and I love those
customer_reviews.author: N. Mathew

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Fantastic build
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Fantastic build. Great clarity in treble and a lot of bass for in-ear headphones. I use them for running and they work perfectly, even with great sound quality due to the noise isolation. Buttons are also very convenient and effective. Best part is the stainless steel build. Right away you can tell these were built extremely well, with quality parts. Very sleek and strong style. If, God forbid, I lose these, I'm just coming back and ordering another pair immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Solid sound, solid build quality, and solid company response
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality for the money. I was initially attracted by the tough-looking build quality because I wear my headphones constantly. All of the junctions are overbuilt. Top marks for this. I did have an issue with one of the drivers coming loose after a year of use, but I got a replacement pair from the company within days. Recommended unless you need a featherweight paid of buds.
customer_reviews.author: Flintlock

customer_reviews.title: Not your typical ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews for every in ear headphones imaginable. I have bought a number of them and have been disappointed. This set does not disappoint. Everything about them is quality. I love the materials they're made from and I love the sound quality. I am beyond happy with my set!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Grauer

customer_reviews.title: You get more than you pay for....
customer_reviews.text: Have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised all around with these. Warm full base, very live mid range and smooth highs. They have been very comfortable and look great. The microphone performs flawlessly. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle DD

customer_reviews.title: Great reasonably priced ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile but have been through a number of earbuds over the years. The sound on these is excellent particularly when paired with Comfort tips that come with them. These are super comfortable and I've used them for long international flights many times. Build quality is excellent. I was worried about the straight plug rather than a 90 degree one, but the plug and cable are heavy duty and have withstood 6 months of abuse without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Now that's some fine quality earphones ..
customer_reviews.text: Coming from Sennheisser Momentum inear and Klipsch Image S4 , the RHA MA750 looked hideous being build like a tank, but once you start listening, it is just phenomenal in every aspect...be its soundstage, depth, sound and build quality, the RHA is one good SoB of an earphone .. Its not too bass heavy as most suggested, though with silicone you kind of feel that; switch to the foam eartips, it's definitely not the case. The base are more neutral, lively highs and sweet mids,.. Oh, boy !! I love it !!... I wanted to try the HiFiman RE400 for its magical mids, but I can't imagine what magical is after listening to the RHA...Definitely recommended !!
customer_reviews.author: Vivek Oliparambil Shanmughan

customer_reviews.title: Fancy....!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy build flat sound. i mean by flat is all levels are equal. really enjoy listening to it controller is hard to pressed (lost 1 star because of that) well priced... you need to hold it in your hand to feel how fancy this thing is....! not a gym/work out headphone...!
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Nurhasan

customer_reviews.title: A keeper, and a steal at this price.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know the science behind what's called burning in, when headphones are played for 24 hours consistently in order to improve the sound, but I can tell you from my experience with these beautiful headphones that the difference made after doing this was quite dramatic. The bass is now very present and punchy, but not overbearing. The mids and highs are quite clear. Handmade single drivers! Thumbs up. A keeper, and a steal at this price. For reference purposes I own Martin Logan electrostatic speakers, beyerdynamic DT990s, as well as a Marantz receiver, and I'm really enjoying these RHA's for my daily commute.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Invest!!
customer_reviews.text: Surprised me quite a bit. I didn't think so small an IEM could have such wonderful soundstage & accurate sound reproduction. They do weigh twice as much as my Westones pro20 but almost sound twice as good. Comfort is absolutely perfect, looks perfect, sounds perfect....
customer_reviews.author: rasta

customer_reviews.title: these are comfortable over-ear IEMs
customer_reviews.text: With the Comply tips, these are comfortable over-ear IEMs. They are slightly V-shaped, so not as neutral as true IEMs for musicians, but I like their versatility, especially at the price. I use them walking around campus as well as tracking drums. Tremendous wide sound, and sturdy construction. Can't beat the warranty either. I have already recommended to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: ttomko

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound, very comfortable pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: A really solid pair of in-ear headphones. I listen to music 24/7 and these things are amazingly comfortable. Sound quality is exceptional. Being able to use the three-button remote and not have to dig into your pocket/bag to pause/change volume is awesome as well as using it's microphone for on the go phone calls. Obviously not cheap but you pay for what you get and I'd say when you throw in the 3 year warranty these are worth more than their price tag. Added side note: RHA's customer service is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Anyway, I have just returned this to the seller ...
customer_reviews.text: Anyway, I have just returned this to the seller today after I found its inserting jack connection was loose for my Sony HR Walkman. Everything of the product looks hard metal that should not be made with the jack loose. I can not rate the quality of the sound according to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: JAmes

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounds for a Solid Price
customer_reviews.text: The RHA MA750i earbuds perform better than any other noise cancelliing devices I ever used. I expected to hear the highs in the treble sound reproductions and the lows in the bass rendering sounds, the RHA did exactly that without my having to break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Quon San WONG

customer_reviews.title: Headphones were OK, but left earbud stopped working after a few days of use.
customer_reviews.text: The shape of the headphones feel nice, the sound is OK and the sound isolation is not so impressive. After using the headphones for a few days the sound in the left earbud simply disappeared to the point I could only faintly hear it in the background (when not using the still functioning right ear-bud). I had been really careful with these headphones and do not understand what caused this. Amazon did refund my order (incl. shipping), but I did not want a replacement, since I was not satisfied with the overall quality of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: J.I.v.Wijgerden

customer_reviews.title: go ahead and try these headphones, you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.text: well, I'm no expert at headphones but these headphones were ALOT better than me beats(executive) headphones the base and treble on these headphones were more clear(huge difference) than my beats. And build quality is also amazing, i think this is indestructible nyahaha. it has exceeded my expectations, i'm listening to music(with these headphones) as I'm writing this review and so far, all the other 5/4 star reviews on this product are on point.
customer_reviews.author: NimSUM

customer_reviews.title: They a pretty hefty headphones
customer_reviews.text: They a pretty hefty headphones. If you are looking for something to go in your pocket they may be a bit bulky. It was also hard to find a good tie for them due to the think connector sheath. Also worth noting that metal connector sheath came loose on mine. Will have to contact their repair. Great sound though and probably as good as you will get from an inline mic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great sounding buds
customer_reviews.text: These are great sounding buds. The problem is that the in-ear buds themselves are quite uncomfortable and begin to hurt after a short while because they are metal and don't flex.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D. Albritton

customer_reviews.title: Overall great earbuds, but be careful with the cord
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and comfort is great, with the over-ear design making for less drops, but... the cord is apparently fragile because I've only had them for 3 months, and I'm losing the sound in the right ear bud depending on the movement of the cord. Their warranty is great though, I got in contact with them about the problem and got sent a replacement pair within days!
customer_reviews.author: db1894

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for the quality of the headphones. Does not work well to control Android phones
customer_reviews.text: Headphones have a good sound to them even with this multiple but options was difficult to find a perfect fit. Unfortunately the wire on one of the headphones has come loose since I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great IEMs, durable and good sound
customer_reviews.text: These lasted me nearly 4 years of constant use, being in and out of my pocket almost daily. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've owned since having an iPhone!
customer_reviews.text: 3 reasons you need these headphones over all the others on the market right now: 1) Great sound. The many ear bud tip options give you just the right fit. I like the foam ones. 2) Great construction. The spring around the base is a brilliant way to prevent wire damage from use over time. The metal construction feels super solid. 3) Great customer service. Fast response, friendly, efficient. Really went above and beyond. 3 year warranty is legit, all companies should stand behind their products like that.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Levine

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great while it lasted. Which wasn't very long.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality. Blocks ambient noise extremely well. BUT the housing for the cables are coming apart. So disappointed. Of course, it started coming apart just after the 3 year warranty ran out. I had taped the cable where the right headphone curls around the ear and noticed today that both the left and right sides have problems where they split apart from the main. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: darlene

customer_reviews.title: These are just great....
customer_reviews.text: I love the construction of these, simply done properly for medium to heavy use... very nice sound, great functions for the phone use. Just had some Monster ones for the same price literally fall apart. Definitely worth the $$$.... good seller, fast shipping, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the headphones for the past 2 months. I was impressed with the sound quality produced with these headphones. Sound was pretty balanced with the treble detailed without being overly fizzy while bass went deep with no bloat and lumpiness. You need to get a good fit with the ear tips and I spent a good amount of time experimenting. A generous range of ear tips is included in the package with 10 different pairs of eartips provided. As I am using Android, the volume buttons do not work that presumably works with IPhones. However, the central button works to pick up calls and/or end calls. Pricey but recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Yeoh

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but will static shock you while you walk
customer_reviews.text: The headphones sound great. However, I have experienced a rather big problem at least for my use. I use these while I walk from class to class and while I am studying and relaxing. When I walk if I keep my phone in my pocket the headphones produce an easy to hear static sound and even shock my ears. This is most likely because of the metal coil at the end of the headphone rubbing on the material of my pants. This only happens with athletic shorts but it is really annoying and slightly painful. Forced to hold my phone while I walk and listen to music. So that is kind of disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones i've ever owned. Worth every penny. Edit 4/17/17. Left ear piece stopped working. Emailed company. They replaced them, no hassle. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: build is really good and has a premium feel
customer_reviews.text: 1 Year running and the head phones are still solid no obvious signs of tear and wear, build is really good and has a premium feel. Con: Volume controls doesnt work on android phones.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Salman

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine was faulty, but amazing headphones quality and design
customer_reviews.text: After 3 weeks, it stopped working properly. The audio was faint on the right ear, and left ear no sound at all. There was no sign of damage, i took care of them really well because of the price i paid. When it was working, it was really amazing head phones. Since i liked them so much, im returning it for the damage but getting the same one.
customer_reviews.author: Dough

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound & Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: These head phones offer a superior fit with the large variety of included ear tips. This is so important to achieving optimal sound, and RHA went out of their way to ensure they provided everyone with an ear tip that will fit. The sound quality is fantastic. It is clear with good, but not overwhelming, bass. You'll begin to hear voices and instruments that used to just blend in with lower quality headphones. The remote works perfectly with Apple devices. Overall, these headphones perform well above their price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Broke on 1st use
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Jack broke upon first use. Do NOT order these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Baker

customer_reviews.title: It's annoying to use my phone buttons in my pocket when ...
customer_reviews.text: Volume buttons do not work with android GS7. It's annoying to use my phone buttons in my pocket when I paid for the functionality of the easy switch. The pause button does at least work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great performer
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones which, so far, are the best iPhone option that I've tested so far. Solid construction and very comfortable with the cord draped over the ear for support. Comparing them to my over ear DT770s they are in the same quality range but in a nice portable size.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Woestman

customer_reviews.title: Good value so far
customer_reviews.text: Ive Had these for half a year or so, great headphones. It's a good idea to take the fittings off and clean out ear wax once in a while. If you let it build up it will eventually block some of the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Country Boy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality, lots of bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Imagine the Audio-Technica ATH-M50s inside of a well-built driver cased in a durable, stainless steel chassis and rubbery cables. The packaging, accessories, and overall quality of these headphones feel like you are paying for their big brother, the T10i. These are fantastic; don't bother comparing these to anything that comes packages in a plastic case at your drug store. Buy them. They are a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Jarron Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Owning several headphones and earbuds before I was amazed immediately after opening the package, the design was astonishing like if these headphones has been designed for some sci-fiction movie, build quality is something that I have not seen before so solid and heavy duty material and yet beautiful and fits very well even while jogging. It reminds me about the first time I have used the MacBook after moving from cheap plastic laptops. Sound quality also not disappointing, comparing it with m50 maybe not fair but these headphones performing amazingly, sound so clear and excellent bass.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim Abu Kteish

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself to be an audiophile, and I own a lot of high end gear. These headphones are so superior to the "Beats", and "Bose". The workmanship, and quality of the product, put them in a league of their own. I highly recommend these units.
customer_reviews.author: R. Y. Shimomura

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones in price range
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I have ever owned. I am hearing elements to my music that I have never heard before. Having previously owned headphones by quality manufacturers like Bose, Shure and etyomics these RHA's blow the competition out of the water in the sub-$200 price point. Only criticism is that they are a little heavy (largely due to premium components) and the cord is about a 1/2 a foot too long.
customer_reviews.author: starbody

customer_reviews.title: Love these earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Love these earbuds. They've got some weight to them, but it adds a nice feel of quality. I had one pair short out at the base of the 3.5mm headphone jack after about a year of light use, but RHA sent me a brand new pair nice and quickly after I contacted them. GREAT customer service. One of the best pairs of in-ear headphones you van buy for under $150.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excelent build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, very solid construction on the IEM, but a not replaceable cable not acceptable in 2019. I have my pair, perfect, but the plug on the other end was destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Leonado Varuzza

customer_reviews.title: Finally... Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: I thought long and hard about leaving a review for this product... I have had headphones that range in price from $5 to $500 and these I would rank #1... The only thing I say to someone considering these is, they have a deep quality bass... The highs are great the lows are even better and the overall design is sexy... The cord is of a nice size gauge and best thing 3 year warranty!!! I would buy a second pair if they came in white...
customer_reviews.author: Just Me...

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is amazing, rich dynamic sound with robust bass. But what really made me write a review was RHA's stellar customer service. The headphones developed a short and no strings attached, the customer service team promptly replaced them no charge. So with the warranty, definitely worth the money. I got stonewalled in the exact situation by Beats, the sound quality of which was already far inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Will Meier

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I've had to hear head sets for 4 months and the play/stop mechanism is broken. I'm trying to get a replacement, but Amazon says its past the replacement date. I am NOT PLEASED. I should be able too o get a replacement pair.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Most people will probably be happy with the smallest pieces
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a variety of earphone pieces to fit most ear canals. Most people will probably be happy with the smallest pieces., The large ones are for people with holes in their heads.
customer_reviews.author: Hard T. PleaseTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use. Fits in a very Small Space
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use, fits in a very small space. It has a wide variety of ear pieces so you are likely to find one that actually fits. The sound seems good though I have played very little music on these. I use them mostly for audio books.
customer_reviews.author: JJS

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing clarity, and the design blocks ambient noise very well. They're not "noise canceling, but they may as well be. Makes listening to MP3's a pleasure. They have a broad, rich stereo field, and they capture the bass end in a way that not many earbuds do. Yes, they are expensive, but through the years I've spent hundreds on various cheap and mid-range earbuds that either broke or were uncomfortable or unlistenable. I finally decided to make the leap and buy a "good pair." I'm glad I did. (Now, if I can just keep from losing the damn things!)
customer_reviews.author: Mie Esplain

customer_reviews.title: Great fit & sound
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable in-ear phones I've ever tried. The sound is great too. I fell asleep with them in & they were still in place when I woke up the next morning. They look very well made too.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Earphones. You're not going to find many earphones ...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant Earphones. You're not going to find many earphones in this price range that sound this good. They definitely need breaking in and after around 40-50 hours, the sound improves substantially. The highs can be a little harsh but using the foam ear tips pretty much resolves this. The build quality is also very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are the best earphones I've ever bought. decent sound quality I like around-ear earphones so this was a perfect choice and memory foam earbuds are amazing. I've never tried this kinda earbuds before and they are awesome; doesn't cancel noise but enough to isolate wires are thick and wide; the end of the wire cord is made with metal and covered with stiff spring give you a lot of protection the only con would be the clicking sound apple remote button makes, but it doesnt bother me that much
customer_reviews.author: Erica N.

customer_reviews.title: It is a good point; however
customer_reviews.text: The cables are durable. It is a good point; however, probably because of the thickness and durability, one side of the cable does not fit well round my ear, in my case. The cable does not stay on my ear. I like the sound. It's deep and natural, not artificial.
customer_reviews.author: stats maniac

customer_reviews.title: I preferred the foam tip and it took a week or two to get comfortable with this
customer_reviews.text: It sounds 'colder' than my thinksound ts02. I preferred the foam tip and it took a week or two to get comfortable with this. Great build quality and have begun to enjoy it now.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: When you get a proper fit these are amazing. Use them on my Harley & sound deadening ...
customer_reviews.text: When you get a proper fit these are amazing. Use them on my Harley & sound deadening and sound quality is VERY impressive. Only down side is they do tangle easy but well worth the price. They make riding even more enjoyable. Again, fit is critical or else they will sound like $10 quality.
customer_reviews.author: CRC978

customer_reviews.title: very nice sound
customer_reviews.text: i had my doubts about this...it does fall out with the buds that were on it..but they have bigger buds to try for better fit...excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.author: chaik george

customer_reviews.title: Sound great and look fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Sound great and look fabulous, but I do not like any of the foam or silicon tips provided. The foam is too hard and uncomfortable and the silicon ones are just not the right size for my ears. Never been a problem with other earphones I've had. One product improvement, and I like the over ear style best I might add, would be too take a leaf out of a rival manufacturer's book and use memory wire for the over ear part. It's so much more secure and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Swales

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, clunky and the clip did not work. Actually too sensitive - any bumping on the wires translates to noise in the headphones so these did not work for me for listening to music while walking. Would not repurchase as I don't use them. Waste of money for me :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and all have disappointed me - either due to poor sound or poor ...
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through various ear buds, and all have disappointed me - either due to poor sound or poor construction (falling apart, breaking, wires pulled apart) - but the RHA ear buds have been nothing but excellent in sound and construction. FINALLY, a product I can recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DML

product_meta.title: RHA MA750i (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Style:RHA MA750i (Discontinued by Manufacturer)RHA MA750i noise isolating premium in ear headphone (with remote and microphone)Handmade dynamic drivers, machined stainless steel and a premium oxygen free copper cable; The MA750i epitomises quality and performance. Using RHA's aerophonic design, 560.1 drivers and a secure over ear fit, the MA750i excels in sound reproduction and a comfortable, noise isolating fit. Sound signature: Precise, balanced and articulate sound reproduction with a great depth of soundstage. 3 year warranty 303F grade stainless steel construction Handmade dynamic driver for clear, natural sound reproduction Reinforced, 1.35m oxygen free cable Signature aerophonic design 10 sets of dual density, silicone and memory foam ear tips 3 button in line remote with 360 Degree mic. What's in the box. RHA MA750i premium noise isolating in ear headphone with remote and microphone Premium carry case 10 sets of dual density, silicone and memory foam ear tips Patent pending stainless steel ear tip holder User guide
feature_bullets: No longer produced by RHA, replaced by newer model: Gen. 2
Handmade dynamic driver for clear, natural sound reproduction

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,277 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
